title: Create SAP-047 (CapabilityServer-Template)
description:
Create SAP-047 (Capability Server Template) - all 6 artifacts (5 + Cookiecutter template).

Epic: chora-base-56s (Capability Server SAP Suite)

Artifacts:
1. Capability Charter (3 hours) - Synthesize all previous SAPs
2. Protocol Spec (5 hours) - Template structure, integration points
3. AGENTS.md (4 hours) - Quick reference for template usage
4. Adoption Blueprint (3 hours) - Essential/Recommended/Advanced tiers
5. Ledger (2 hours) - Adoption tracking, time savings metrics
6. Cookiecutter/Copier Template (8 hours) - Template repository with Jinja2 templates

Total effort: 25 hours
Weeks: 9-10
Phase: 3 (Integration SAPs)
Dependencies: ALL previous SAPs (SAP-042 through SAP-046)

Source: docs/dev-docs/research/capability-server-architecture-research-report.md (Part 6 + synthesis)

title: Add YAML frontmatter to 5 core SAPs
description: Add standardized YAML frontmatter to AGENTS.md files for SAP-001, SAP-002, SAP-004, SAP-010, SAP-015. Enables automated discovery via sap-evaluator.py. Estimated: 4 hours (5 SAPs √ó 15 min each). Trace: week1-quick-wins-frontmatter

title: Week 5.3: Implement heartbeat lease (30s TTL, Service-type only)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Implement heartbeat service for Service-type capabilities (10s interval, 30s TTL). Service writes health status to etcd, registry monitors TTL expiration. Deliverable: services/registry-heartbeat/
acceptance_criteria: Heartbeat service operational (Service-type capabilities report health every 10s)

title: Create SAP-046 (Composition)
description:
Create SAP-046 (Service Composition Patterns) - all 5 artifacts.

Epic: chora-base-56s (Capability Server SAP Suite)

Artifacts:
1. Capability Charter (3 hours) - Extract from research Part 5
2. Protocol Spec (6 hours) - Orchestration vs choreography, Saga pattern, failure handling
3. AGENTS.md (4 hours) - Quick reference for service composition
4. Adoption Blueprint (4 hours) - Essential/Recommended/Advanced tiers
5. Ledger (2 hours) - Adoption tracking, comparison to AWS Step Functions/Temporal

Total effort: 19 hours
Weeks: 7-8
Phase: 3 (Integration SAPs)
Dependencies: SAP-044 (Registry), SAP-043 (MultiInterface)

Source: docs/dev-docs/research/capability-server-architecture-research-report.md (Part 5)

title: Week 4.2: Validate dual-mode lookups (old + new namespaces)
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Implement and validate dual-mode registry lookup with alias mechanism (old namespace ‚Üí new namespace). Test backward compatibility for all 8 pilot capabilities. Deliverable: scripts/registry-lookup.py with alias support
acceptance_criteria: Dual-mode lookups functional (old namespace resolves to new namespace with deprecation warning)

title: Week 8.3: Implement Dublin Core ‚Üí PyPI metadata mapping
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Implement script to map Dublin Core metadata to PyPI classifiers and keywords. Convert dc:description ‚Üí PyPI description, dc:subject ‚Üí keywords, dc:creator ‚Üí author. Deliverable: scripts/map-dublin-core-to-pypi.py
acceptance_criteria: Dublin Core ‚Üí PyPI metadata mapping accurate for all 45 SAPs

title: Week 4.3: Test cross-type dependency resolution
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Test cross-type dependency resolution: Service ‚Üí Pattern (advisory warnings) and Pattern ‚Üí Service (health check validation). Implement test cases for all 7 relationship types. Deliverable: tests/test_cross_type_dependencies.py
acceptance_criteria: Cross-type dependencies resolve correctly (Service ‚Üí Pattern shows advisory, Pattern ‚Üí Service validates health)

title: Week 5.4: Extend registry for Pattern-type (static Git sync, no heartbeat)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Implement static Git sync for Pattern-type capabilities (no heartbeat monitoring). Pattern metadata loaded from YAML, stored in etcd as static entries. Deliverable: scripts/sync-pattern-registry.py
acceptance_criteria: Pattern registry syncs from Git without heartbeat (documentation-only capabilities)

title: Week 6.3: Implement CLI search (chora search --type filter)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Implement 'chora search' CLI command with semantic search, type filtering (--type Service|Pattern), artifact search. Use PostgreSQL FTS for keyword search. Deliverable: cli/search.py
acceptance_criteria: CLI search functional (chora search returns both Service and Pattern results, --type filter works)

title: Week 3.3: Implement migration script (sap-catalog.json ‚Üí YAML)
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Implement automated migration script that converts sap-catalog.json entries to unified YAML manifests. Handle Service-type (6 capability servers) and Pattern-type (39 SAPs) with appropriate metadata. Deliverable: scripts/migrate-sap-catalog.py
acceptance_criteria: Migration script converts all 45 SAPs from sap-catalog.json to YAML manifests

title: Setup daily logging workflow and baseline metrics
description: Create daily logging templates, run baseline L3 checks (sap015-metrics.py, a-mem-metrics.py), document starting metrics. Estimated: 2 hours. Trace: week1-workflow-setup

title: Phase 5: Update ledger to L3 Production + create adoption event
description:
Update SAP-015 ledger and promote to L3 Production status.

Actions:
1. Update ledger frontmatter (status: pilot ‚Üí production, version bump)
2. Add v2.0.0 version history entry with L3 achievements
3. Update adoption metrics (5+ projects, ROI metrics)
4. Create knowledge note documenting L3 journey
5. Log L3 achievement event to A-MEM
6. Update sap-catalog.json (status: pilot ‚Üí production)

Similar to SAP-028 v1.1.0 ledger update.

Trace: sap-015-phase5-ledger

title: Fix SAP-047: Change Cookiecutter to Copier
description:
Update SAP-047 (CapabilityServer-Template) to use Copier instead of Cookiecutter, aligning with SAP-003 (project-bootstrap) which already uses Copier.

Root cause: Created SAP-047 without checking existing tool adoptions. Research report mentioned 'Cookiecutter/Copier' as options, but SAP-003 already established Copier as the project scaffolding tool.

Files to update:
- capability-charter.md: Change 'Cookiecutter template' ‚Üí 'Copier template'
- protocol-spec.md: Update template configuration from Cookiecutter to Copier syntax
- AGENTS.md: Change 'cookiecutter generate' ‚Üí 'copier copy'
- adoption-blueprint.md: Update installation from 'pip install cookiecutter' ‚Üí 'pip install copier'
- ledger.md: Update all references to Cookiecutter ‚Üí Copier

Also update:
- chora-base-6x5 (Test SAP-047 template) task description to use Copier

Deliverable: SAP-047 aligned with existing tooling (SAP-003)
Effort: 2 hours
Priority: P0 (blocks template testing)

comments.author: victorpiper

Changed: template structure, variable syntax ({{cookiecutter.var}} ‚Üí {{var}}), installation instructions, ROI calculations, and adoption strategy. Now updating protocol-spec.md...

Now moving to adoption-blueprint.md...

title: Update INDEX.md with Capability Server SAPs

Add 'Capability Server Development' section to docs/skilled-awareness/INDEX.md with SAPs 042-047 grouped with descriptions. Add cross-reference matrix showing dependencies between SAPs. Update navigation and table of contents.

Source: PLAN-2025-11-11-CAPABILITY-SERVER-SAPS.md (Week 11, missing deliverable)
Effort: 1-2 hours
Phase: 4 (Ecosystem Integration)

title: Week 6.2: Index SAP artifacts (5 per Pattern)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Extract and index 5 SAP artifacts (capability-charter, protocol-spec, awareness-guide, adoption-blueprint, ledger) for each Pattern-type capability. Index full-text content in PostgreSQL. Deliverable: scripts/index-sap-artifacts.py
acceptance_criteria: SAP artifact indexing complete (5 artifacts √ó 39 Pattern-type capabilities = 195 artifacts indexed)

title: Capability Server SAP Suite (SAP-042 to SAP-047)
description: Create 6 new SAPs for capability server development patterns based on capability server architecture research report. Deprecate SAP-014 (mcp-server-development) and integrate MCP patterns into multi-interface SAP. Timeline: 16 weeks across 5 phases.

title: Week 5.1: Deploy 3-node etcd cluster (Docker Compose)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Deploy 3-node etcd cluster with Raft consensus for distributed registry. Configure for 10k reads/sec, <10ms latency. Load test with 1000 concurrent requests. Deliverable: infrastructure/etcd/docker-compose.yaml
acceptance_criteria: etcd cluster operational (>99% uptime, <10ms p95 latency)

title: Test SAP-047 Template Generation Script
description:
Test SAP-047 (CapabilityServer-Template) by generating a sample capability server project:
- Install Jinja2 (if needed): pip install jinja2
- Navigate to chora-base repository
- Run template generation: python scripts/create-capability-server.py with test parameters
- Verify generated project structure (core/, interfaces/, config/, tests/, docs/)
- Test all 3-4 interfaces (CLI, REST, MCP, optionally GraphQL)
- Verify bootstrap sequence integration
- Verify registry integration (manifest.yaml)
- Verify composition patterns (saga, circuit breaker, events)
- Run generated tests (pytest, ‚â•80% coverage target)
- Build Docker image (<250MB target)
- Document any issues or improvements in SAP-047 ledger

Source: PLAN-2025-11-11-CAPABILITY-SERVER-SAPS.md (Week 16)
Effort: 3-4 hours
Phase: 5 (Validation)
Deliverable: Test report + ledger update

Note: Updated to reflect Jinja2-based generation script (not Cookiecutter) per chora-base-43o fix.

title: Week 3.2: Create CI/CD duplicate detection workflow
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Create GitHub Actions workflow for duplicate namespace detection, JSON Schema validation, and artifact link verification. Deliverable: .github/workflows/validate-capabilities.yaml
acceptance_criteria: CI/CD workflow runs on PR and blocks merges with validation errors

title: Week 1.1: Finalize 20 domain categories
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Finalize 20 domain categories with descriptions, examples, and allocation guidelines. Document namespace allocation strategy to prevent collisions. Deliverable: docs/ontology/domain-taxonomy.md
acceptance_criteria: All 20 domains documented with at least 2 examples each

title: ONT Phase 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-4)
description: Phase 1 of Ecosystem Ontology initiative: Establish unified ontology standards, validation tooling, and pilot migration for Service-type and Pattern-type capabilities. Coordination: COORD-2025-015

title: Week 6.1: Setup PostgreSQL FTS (GIN indexes)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Setup PostgreSQL Full-Text Search with GIN indexes on Service metadata and Pattern artifact content. Create ts_vector columns, configure search ranking. Deliverable: database/migrations/001_fts_indexes.sql
acceptance_criteria: PostgreSQL FTS operational (search queries <100ms for 45 capabilities)

title: Create Release Notes for 6 New SAPs
description:
Write comprehensive release notes for SAP-042 through SAP-047:
- Executive summary of capability server SAP suite
- Individual SAP highlights with ROI and key features
- Adoption recommendations (order, use cases, prerequisites)
- Breaking changes (SAP-014 deprecation, migration path)
- Installation/adoption instructions
- Integration examples
- Known issues and limitations
- Future roadmap (v1.1.0, v2.0.0 features)
- Acknowledgments and references

Deliverable: docs/project-docs/releases/RELEASE-2025-11-12-CAPABILITY-SERVER-SAPS.md
Source: PLAN-2025-11-11-CAPABILITY-SERVER-SAPS.md (Week 16)
Effort: 2-3 hours
Phase: 5 (Validation)

title: Week 1.4: Define unified capability types (Service vs Pattern)
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Define Service-type (runtime capability servers) vs Pattern-type (knowledge SAPs) with metadata profiles, dependency semantics, and discovery patterns. Deliverable: docs/ontology/capability-types.md
acceptance_criteria: Capability type definitions complete with Dublin Core dc:type extension documented

title: Week 8.4: Migrate all 45 SAPs (6 Service + 39 Pattern)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Execute full migration of all 45 SAPs to unified namespace: 6 Service-type (SAP-042-047) and 39 Pattern-type (all remaining SAPs). Validate metadata, run JSON Schema validation, publish to PyPI. Deliverable: capabilities/ with 45 YAML manifests
acceptance_criteria: All 45 SAPs migrated (6 Service + 39 Pattern) with valid metadata and PyPI packages published

title: Week 1.3: Create migration mapping (old ‚Üí new)
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Create migration mapping from old sap-catalog.json entries to new unified YAML manifests. Map all 45 SAPs to new namespace. Deliverable: docs/ontology/migration-guide.md
acceptance_criteria: All 45 SAPs mapped to chora.domain.capability namespace

title: Week 7.2: Create SemVer constraint validator
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Implement SemVer constraint validation (^, ~, >=, <, etc.). Parse version ranges, check compatibility. Use node-semver compatible parsing. Deliverable: core/semver_validator.py
acceptance_criteria: SemVer validator passes for all constraint types (^1.0.0, ~2.3.0, >=1.5.0 <2.0.0)

title: Achieve SAP-015 L3 Production Maturity
description:
Work toward L3 maturity for SAP-015 (task-tracking with beads).

L3 Success Criteria (from capability-charter.md):
- Multi-adopter: 5+ projects using beads
- ROI metrics: Time savings ‚â•20% on context re-establishment
- Multi-agent coordination: 2+ agents using shared task db
- Advanced dependency tracking: Complex task graphs
- Automation: Integration with SAP-010 (A-MEM), SAP-001 (inbox)

Current Status: L1 Pilot (1 repo, dogfooding phase)
Target: L3 Production by Q2 2026

Trace: sap-015-l3-roadmap

acceptance_criteria: Cross-type dependency resolution works (Service ‚Üí Pattern advisory, Pattern ‚Üí Service health check)

title: Explore new capability opportunities
description: Review SAP gaps using sap-evaluator.py, consider improvements to SAP-009 (agent-awareness) based on lessons learned, evaluate opportunities for new SAPs. Trace: sap-exploration-2025-11

comments.author: victorpiper
comments.text:
Exploration Complete - Opportunities Identified:

**1. Production Data Collection (High Priority)**
- SAP-010 (Memory System): 2/5 L3 criteria met, needs 2-3 months data
- SAP-015 (Task Tracking): 4/5 L3 criteria met, needs 2-3 months data
- Recommendation: Continue dogfooding both SAPs actively

**2. SAP Maturity Gaps (sap-evaluator findings)**
- 29 SAPs installed, avg level: 1.00 (basic adoption)
- 0 SAPs at L2 (Advanced) or L3 (Production)
- Priority gaps: Test coverage (SAP-004: 0% < 85%), YAML frontmatter missing in AGENTS.md files
- Opportunity: Deepen adoption of existing SAPs vs creating new ones

**3. SAP-009 (Agent Awareness) Improvements**
- Learned from SAP-010/015 L3 work: better ROI tracking patterns
- Could add A-MEM + beads integration examples
- Progressive context loading patterns working well (could document more)

**4. Documentation Quality**
- Missing YAML frontmatter in many AGENTS.md files (SAP-001, SAP-002, SAP-004+)
- Could improve consistency across SAP awareness files
- Link validation infrastructure exists (SAP-016) but needs active use

**5. New SAP Opportunities** (if needed)
- None critical - focus on deepening existing SAPs first
- SAP-029 (SAP Generation) could be formalized (Plan A from earlier)
- But dogfooding existing infrastructure is higher ROI

**Recommendation Ranking**:
1. üî• Dogfood SAP-015 + SAP-010 for 2-3 months (production data)
2. üéØ Fix YAML frontmatter gaps (quick wins, improves consistency)
3. üìä Add test coverage to close SAP-004 gap
4. üìö Document lessons learned from L3 work (improve SAP-009)
5. üÜï Consider new SAPs only after existing ones reach L2/L3

title: Week 2.4: Define SAP-specific metadata fields

Document extraction methodology from existing SAPs. Deliverable: Update docs/ontology/capability-types.md with SAP metadata section
acceptance_criteria: SAP-specific metadata fields documented with examples from 3 pilot SAPs

Deliverables: schemas/capability-service.schema.json, schemas/capability-pattern.schema.json, schemas/capability-common.schema.json
acceptance_criteria: JSON Schema validators pass for all example manifests in capabilities/SCHEMA-EXAMPLES.yaml

title: Review SAP-010 L3 progress and plan next steps
description: SAP-010 currently at Pilot (2/5 L3 criteria met). Review what's needed for L3 Production: production data collection, metrics validation, integration testing. Trace: sap-010-l3-continuation

comments.author: victorpiper
comments.text:
SAP-010 L3 Review Complete:

**Current Status**: Pilot (2/5 L3 criteria met)

**L3 Criteria Progress**:
‚úÖ Multi-adopter: 2 projects (chora-base + chora-compose)
‚úÖ Context restoration: 97.2% time saved (target: ‚â•80%)
‚è≥ Knowledge queries: 1.0 avg (target: ‚â•3) - need daily usage data
‚è≥ Note reuse: 0% (target: ‚â•50%) - need reuse tracking
‚è≥ Mistake reduction: 0% (target: ‚â•30%) - need 30-60 days baseline

**Infrastructure Complete**:
- 7 ROI tracking scripts built
- Multi-adopter expansion validated
- Knowledge base started (3 notes, 10 tags, 1 link)
- Auto-indexing, compression, metrics dashboard operational

**Next Steps for L3 Production**:
1. Collect 2-3 months production data
2. Track knowledge queries actively (scripts ready)
3. Track note reuse patterns (scripts ready)
4. Establish 30-60 day mistake baseline (scripts ready)
5. Promote to L3 Production when 5/5 criteria met

**Recommendation**: Continue dogfooding A-MEM alongside SAP-015 (beads). Both SAPs need production data collection.

title: Week 5.2: Configure GitOps sync (Git ‚Üí etcd)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Implement GitOps sync script that watches capabilities/ directory and syncs changes to etcd (1-minute interval). Handle YAML parsing, validation, and etcd writes. Deliverable: scripts/gitops-sync-registry.py
acceptance_criteria: GitOps sync functional (Git changes reflected in etcd within 1 minute)

title: Create Capability Server Suite Overview
description:
Write comprehensive overview document linking all 6 capability server SAPs (SAP-042 through SAP-047). Include:
- Summary of each SAP with quick reference
- Adoption roadmap (recommended order: SAP-042 ‚Üí SAP-043/SAP-044 ‚Üí SAP-045 ‚Üí SAP-046 ‚Üí SAP-047)
- Integration patterns showing how SAPs work together
- Architecture diagrams showing relationships
- End-to-end workflow examples
- ROI summary across all 6 SAPs

Location: docs/skilled-awareness/capability-server-suite-overview.md
Source: PLAN-2025-11-11-CAPABILITY-SERVER-SAPS.md (Week 15)
Effort: 3-4 hours
Phase: 5 (Validation)

title: Phase 3: Validate A-MEM integration in practice
description:
Actually use beads + A-MEM integration documented in protocol-spec.md.

Actions:
1. Log A-MEM events with beads_task_id fields
2. Create beads tasks with trace_id fields
3. Demonstrate traceability: A-MEM events ‚Üí beads tasks
4. Update A-MEM scripts to support beads correlation
5. Create example showing 'what was done' (A-MEM) ‚Üí 'what to do' (beads)

This validates the theoretical integration we documented but never tested.

Trace: sap-015-phase3-amem

title: Week 7.1: Implement Kahn's algorithm (topological sort)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Implement Kahn's algorithm for topological sort with cross-type support (Service ‚Üî Pattern dependencies). Detect cycles, handle conditional dependencies. O(V+E) complexity. Deliverable: core/dependency_resolver.py
acceptance_criteria: Kahn's algorithm resolves dependencies with cycle detection and cross-type support

title: Week 7.4: Create dependency graph visualizer (Graphviz)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Generate Graphviz DOT graphs for dependency visualization. Color nodes by type (Service=blue, Pattern=green), edges by relationship type. Export to SVG/PNG. Deliverable: tools/visualize-dependencies.py
acceptance_criteria: Dependency graph visualization includes type colors and relationship labels

title: Week 2.2: Create YAML manifest templates (Service + Pattern)
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Create boilerplate YAML templates for Service-type and Pattern-type capabilities. Include all Dublin Core fields, spec sections, and inline documentation. Deliverables: capabilities/template-service.yaml, capabilities/template-pattern.yaml
acceptance_criteria: Both templates created with complete metadata sections and inline examples

title: Add tests for 5 core automation scripts
description: Write pytest tests for: sap-evaluator.py, sap015-metrics.py, a-mem-metrics.py, a-mem-beads-correlation.py, generate-sap.py. Target: 49.7% ‚Üí 65%+ coverage. Demonstrates SAP-004 dogfooding. Estimated: 4-6 hours. Trace: week1-quick-wins-tests

‚úÖ sap-evaluator.py: 11 CLI tests created (test_sap_evaluator_cli.py)

Remaining: sap015-metrics.py, a-mem-metrics.py, a-mem-beads-correlation.py

title: ONT Phase 2: Discovery (Weeks 5-8)
description: Phase 2 of Ecosystem Ontology initiative: Deploy hybrid registry (Git + etcd + PyPI) with unified discovery for Service-type and Pattern-type capabilities. Coordination: COORD-2025-016

title: Week 6.4: Deploy REST API (/api/v1/capabilities)
description: Phase 2 Epic: chora-base-on1. Deploy REST API with GET /api/v1/capabilities endpoint. Support query params (q, type, domain, page). Return JSON with Service/Pattern filtering. Deliverable: api/capabilities/
acceptance_criteria: REST API deployed (GET /api/v1/capabilities?type=Service returns only runtime capabilities)

title: Create SAP-043 (MultiInterface)
description:
Create SAP-043 (Multi-Interface Architecture) - all 5 artifacts + MCP integration from deprecated SAP-014.

Epic: chora-base-56s (Capability Server SAP Suite)

Artifacts:
1. Capability Charter (3 hours) - Extract from research Part 1, document SAP-014 deprecation
2. Protocol Spec (6 hours) - Core + adapters pattern, integrate SAP-014 MCP content
3. AGENTS.md (4 hours) - Quick reference with code examples (Native/CLI/REST/MCP)
4. Adoption Blueprint (4 hours) - Essential/Recommended/Advanced tiers, SAP-014 migration path
5. Ledger (2 hours) - Adoption tracking, SAP-014 deprecation notes

Total effort: 19 hours
Weeks: 2-3
Phase: 1 (Foundation SAPs)
Dependencies: SAP-042 (InterfaceDesign) should be complete for cross-referencing

title: Review AGENTS.md/CLAUDE.md Alignment with Adopted SAPs
description:
Audit all AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md files to ensure they properly document how to use ALL adopted SAPs. Goal: close the gap between 'SAP adopted' and 'SAP actually used in practice.'

Tasks:
1. List all adopted SAPs from sap-catalog.json (status: production, pilot, active)
2. For each adopted SAP, verify documentation in relevant AGENTS.md files:
   - Root AGENTS.md: Does it document SAP usage patterns?
   - Domain AGENTS.md: Do domain files explain SAP integration?
   - Component AGENTS.md: Do components document SAP usage?
3. Check CLAUDE.md files for Claude-specific SAP workflows
4. Identify gaps where SAPs are adopted but not documented in awareness files
5. Add missing documentation for seamless SAP usage
6. Create templates/examples for common SAP workflows

Specific SAPs to verify:
- SAP-009 (agent-awareness): Are nested awareness patterns explained?
- SAP-015 (task-tracking): Is beads usage documented in workflows?
- SAP-001 (inbox): Is coordination protocol explained?
- SAP-010 (A-MEM): Is event memory usage documented?
- SAP-019 (sap-self-evaluation): Is evaluation process explained?
- SAP-042-047 (capability-server): Are new SAPs integrated?

Deliverable: Updated AGENTS.md/CLAUDE.md files + gap analysis report
Effort: 4-6 hours
Priority: P0 (critical for consistent SAP usage)

title: Triage COORD-2025-003: v1.9.0 Docs Update
description:
Triage overdue coordination request from chora-compose:
- ID: COORD-2025-003
- Title: Update chora-base documentation for v1.9.0 capabilities
- From: chora-compose
- Status: accepted (but overdue)
- Original timeline: 2025-W44 (Nov 4-10) - NOW PAST DUE
- Effort: 2.75-4.25 hours
- Acceptance criteria: 5 items

Actions:
1. Read full coordination request (inbox/coordination/COORD-2025-003-v190-capabilities-update.json)
2. Assess current status and blockers
3. Determine if work was already completed
4. If not complete, decompose into beads tasks
5. Update coordination status in inbox
6. Respond to chora-compose with timeline

Source: inbox/coordination/ECOSYSTEM_STATUS.yaml
Priority: P2 (overdue but not blocking)

title: 90-day production data collection (SAP-015 + SAP-010)
description: Collect production data for L3 validation over 90 days (Nov 2025 - Jan 2026). Daily: log context time, query knowledge, track tasks. Weekly: create knowledge notes, review velocity. Monthly: run L3 dashboard. GO/NO-GO decision: Week 12. Target: SAP-015 & SAP-010 promoted to L3 Production by Feb 2026. Trace: 90-day-l3-production

title: Phase 4: Multi-agent coordination validation
description:
Validate multi-agent task coordination using beads.

Actions:
1. Use beads in 2+ different environments (Claude Code + Claude Desktop, or different machines)
2. Test git-based task synchronization
3. Validate hash-based ID collision prevention
4. Test dependency resolution across agents
5. Document multi-agent workflows

This proves beads works for team collaboration, not just single-agent.

Trace: sap-015-phase4-multiagent

title: Week 2.1: Define Dublin Core schema with chora extensions
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Define Dublin Core metadata schema (15 core elements) with chora extensions for Service and Pattern types. Include dc:type, dc:relation (typed dependencies), and ontology fields. Deliverable: docs/ontology/dublin-core-schema.md
acceptance_criteria: Dublin Core schema documented with all 15 elements + chora extensions

title: Week 4.1: Migrate 8 pilot capabilities (5 Service + 3 Pattern)
description: Phase 1 Epic: chora-base-8d7. Migrate 8 pilot capabilities: SAP-042-047 (Service-type: interface-design, multi-interface, registry, bootstrap, composition, capability-server-template) and SAP-041, SAP-009, SAP-004 (Pattern-type: react-form-validation, agent-awareness, testing-framework). Deliverable: 8 YAML manifests in capabilities/
